Subject: Manuscripts--Arab countries
Title: Ḥālnāmah = The book of ecstasy
Description.note: Minasian Collection of Near Eastern Manuscripts (Collection 1147), 1147/13|~|Text in Persian, Object descriptionLayout: Average of 12 lines of text per page.Script: Nasta̒ lῑq.Decoration: Illumination on title page; paper is painted in blue and gold floral motifs.Binding: Red leather binding with three medallions blind stamped on cover.Additional description: The leaves decorated in yellows, greens, and blues, with gold floral    motifs. The text in black, chapter headings in gold.
Description.abstract: Belles-lettres. Mystical story in verse, also known as Gūy va chawgān, yā, Ḥālnāmah (The ball and polo stick, or, The book of ecstasy).

Title: Qur’ān [MS 1656/10]
Description.note: Fragment containing parts or all of four short chapters 84 to 87, including: verses 16 to 25 of al-inshiqāq (The sundering), all of al-Burῡj (The mansions of the stars), all of al-Ṭāriq (The morning star), and verses 1 through 14 and the first two words of verse 15 from al-A̒alá (The most high).

Subject: Manuscripts--Arab countries
Title: Tarassul = Lettering writing
Description.note: Minasian Collection of Near Eastern Manuscripts (Collection 1147), 1147/5.|~|Text in Persian.
Description.abstract: Correspondence manual. This is a handbook of official correspondence, meant for secretaries, providing samples of letters to various government functionaries or potentates according to rank or the occasion. These include not only letters addressed to Sultans (3b), letters to Sultans on occasion of victories (4b), letters addressed to supreme Emirs (9b), viziers (11b), judges (16b), etc.; but also how to answer such letters.

Subject: Manuscripts--Arab countries
Title: Kanz al-lughāt = Treasure of words
Description.note: Minasian Collection of Near Eastern Manuscripts (Collection 1147), 1147/1Ms. 1057/1.|~|Author: Muḥammad ibn ̒Abd al-Khāliq ibn Ma ̒arῡf, fl. 16th cent?Scribe:Ibn Abῡ Turāb Muḥammad Ibrāhῑm (al-Ḥusayn?).Origin: Ṣafawid Persia
Description.abstract: Persian dictionary of Koranic Arabic and Hadith terms. The author praises Sulṭan Muḥammad and his heir (2a) and calls them "The adornment of the Hall of the Musṭafawῑ lineage, and the decoration of the pride of the Murtaḍawῑ family," implying a Sayyid king, possibly Ṣafawid. If so, the named Sulṭan would be Sulṭan Muḥammad Khudābandah father of Shāh  ̒Abbās, and the date of composition would fall between 1577-1586 CE.

Subject: Manuscripts--Arab countries
Title: Tuḥfat al-zā ̒ir = The pilgrim's gift
Description.note: Qayani Collection of Arabic and Persian Manuscripts (Collection 1053), 1053/9
Description.abstract: Religion. Majlisῑ’s Ṣafawid-period treatise on pilgrimage, with a guide for reading one's fortune using the manuscript written on the very last leaf (304b). The author states that he wrote the book in Persian because most people could not read the Arabic books written on this topic.  Text in Persian and Arabic
